sentences.text: DEAR STOCKHOLDER:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are cordially invited to attend our 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders (the Annual Meeting) to be held on Wednesday, May 24, 2017 at 2:00 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Central Daylight Time at the Hilton Garden Inn Chicago OHare, 2930 South River Road, Des Plaines, Illinois 60018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the Annual Meeting, you will be asked to consider and vote on the following matters:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. the election to the Board of Directors (the Board) of the 10 nominees for director named in this proxy statement;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. an advisory vote to approve executive compensation (the say-on-pay vote);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. an advisory vote to approve the frequency of the advisory vote to approve executive compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. ratification of the appointment of Ernst & Young LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for 2017;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. approval of an amendment to the Companys Employee Stock Purchase Plan increasing the number of shares available for issuance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6. approval of the Stericycle, Inc. 2017 Incentive Stock Plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 7. a stockholder proposal entitled Shareholder Proxy Access Reform;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 8. a stockholder proposal on the vesting of equity awards upon a change in control; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 9. any other matter that properly comes before the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only stockholders of record at the close of business on the record date of March 31, 2017 are entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Admission to the Annual Meeting requires an admissions card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you plan to attend the meeting in person, please complete and return the Admission Request Form on the back cover of this proxy statement and an admissions card will be mailed to you.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are the beneficial owner of shares held in street name, you must also provide confirmation of your stock ownership with your Admission Request Form.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Admission Request Forms must be received by May 17, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An admissions card is not transferable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you need directions to the meeting, please call Investor Relations at (800) 643-0240 ext. 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the convenience of our stockholders of record who do not plan to attend the Annual Meeting in person but who want their shares voted, we have enclosed a proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not plan to attend the Annual Meeting, please complete and return the proxy card in the envelope provided or go to www.proxyvote.com and follow the instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you return your proxy card and later decide to attend the Annual Meeting and then vote in person, your earlier proxy card (or earlier vote by telephone or Internet) will be revoked.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your attendance at the Annual Meeting, by itself, does not revoke an earlier proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If for any other reason you want to revoke your proxy, you may do so at any time before your proxy is voted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why Did I Receive This Proxy Statement and Other Materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors (the Board) of Stericycle, Inc. is soliciting proxies to vote shares of our common stock at the 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders (the Annual Meeting) to be held on Wednesday, May 24, 2017 at 2:00 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Central Daylight Time, at the Hilton Garden Inn Chicago OHare, 2930 South River Road, Des Plaines, Illinois 60018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proxy statement and our annual report to stockholders (which includes a copy of our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2016), are first being made available to stockholders on or about April 14, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although both are made available together, our annual report to stockholders is not part of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who May Vote at the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only stockholders of record as of the close of business on March 31, 2017 are entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each outstanding share of common stock as of the record date is entitled to one vote on all matters that come before the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There is no cumulative voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the close of business on the record date of March 31, 2017, there were 85,261,594 shares of our common stock issued and outstanding
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why Did I Receive Only a One-Page Notice in the Mail Regarding the Internet Availability of Proxy Materials Instead of Receiving a Full Set of Printed Proxy Materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the notice and access rules of the SEC, we have elected to provide access to our proxy materials, including this proxy statement and our annual report to stockholders, over the Internet, and accordingly, we mailed our stockholders a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (the Notice) on or about April 14, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Notice contains instructions on how to access our proxy materials over the Internet, how to request a printed or electronic copy of these materials and how to vote by Internet, telephone or mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The voting facilities over the Internet or by telephone will remain open until 11:59 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eastern Daylight Time on May 23, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice is not a proxy card and cannot be used to vote your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is the Difference Between a Stockholder of Record and a Beneficial Owner of Shares Held in Street Name?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are registered directly in your name with our stock registrar and transfer agent, Wells Fargo Shareowner Services, you are considered the stockholder of record for those shares and have the right to vote those shares directly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote in person at the Annual Meeting or by proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held in an account at a brokerage firm, bank or other nominee (for convenient reference, a broker), you are considered the beneficial owner of those shares, which are said to be held in street name, and the broker is considered the stockholder of record for voting purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the beneficial owner you cannot vote the shares in your account directly, but you have the right to instruct the broker how to vote them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a beneficial owner, you are invited to attend the Annual Meeting, but because you are not a stockholder of record, you may not vote your shares at the Annual Meeting unless you obtain a valid proxy from your broker.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See How Can I Attend the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: below for further information and instructions on how to obtain an admissions card to attend the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If I Am a Stockholder of Record, How Do I Vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote in several ways.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote in person at the Annual Meeting, or you may vote by proxy over the Internet or by telephone by following the instructions provided in the Notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, if you request copies of our proxy materials in printed form, you may vote by completing and signing the proxy card included in the materials and returning it in the postage-paid envelope provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If I Am a Beneficial Owner of Shares Held in Street Name, How Do I Instruct My Broker How to Vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a beneficial owner of our common stock, the Notice was forwarded to you by your broker.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may instruct your broker how to vote over the Internet or by telephone by following the instructions provided by your broker.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, if you request copies of our proxy materials in printed form, you may instruct your broker how to vote by completing and signing the voting instruction card included in the materials and returning it in the postage-paid envelope provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What Happens If I am a Stockholder of Record and Sign and Return the Proxy Card but Do Not Make Any Voting Choices?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proxy holders (the persons named as proxies) will vote your shares in accordance with the Boards voting recommendations for Items 1-8 described in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See What are the Boards voting recommendations?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not expect that any other matters will properly come before the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If, however, any other matters do come before the meeting, the proxy holders will vote your shares in accordance with their judgment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What Happens If I Am a Beneficial Owner of Shares Held in Street Name and Do Not Give Voting Instructions to My Broker?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the stock exchange and other rules governing brokers who are voting shares held in street name, brokers have authority to vote those shares at their discretion on routine matters but may not vote those shares on non-routine matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ratification of the appointment of Ernst & Young LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for 2017 (Item 4) is considered a routine matter under the relevant rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the other items to be voted on (Items 1, 2, 3, 5, 6, 7 and 8) are considered non-routine matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A broker non-vote occurs when your broker returns a proxy card for your shares held in street name but does not vote on a particular matter because
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the broker has not received voting instructions from you and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the broker does not have authority to vote on the matter without instructions because the matter is of a non-routine nature.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker non-votes will not have any effect on the result of the vote when they occur.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There will be not be any broker non-votes on the ratification of the appointment of Ernst & Young LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for 2017 (Item 4), because brokers will have discretionary authority to vote on this matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stericycle, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: - 2017 Proxy Statement    7
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What Is the Quorum Required for the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Holders of a majority of our outstanding shares entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting who are present in person or represented by proxy will constitute a quorum to conduct business at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a stockholder of record and vote your shares by proxy, your shares will be counted for purposes of determining whether a quorum is present even if your voting choice is to abstain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similarly, if you are a beneficial owner of shares held in street name and do not give voting instructions to your broker, your shares will be counted for purposes of determining whether a quorum is present if your broker votes your shares on any routine matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What Are My Choices in Voting on the Matters to Be Voted on at the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On Item 1 (the election of directors), you may vote For or Against each individual nominee or Abstain from voting on the nominees election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On Item 2 (the say-on-pay vote), Item 4 (ratification of the appointment of Ernst & Young LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for 2017), Item 5 (approval of an amendment to the Companys Employee Stock Purchase Plan increasing the number of shares available for issuance), Item 6 (approval of the Stericycle, Inc. 2017 Incentive Stock Plan), Item 7 (stockholder proposal entitled Shareholder Proxy Access Reform) and Item 8 (stockholder proposal on the vesting of equity awards upon a change in control ), you may vote For or Against the proposal or Abstain from voting on the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On Item 3 (the advisory vote to approve the frequency of the advisory vote to approve executive compensation), you may vote for a frequency of One Year, Two Years, Three Years or may Abstain from voting on your desired frequency of the say-on-pay vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What Are the Voting Requirements to Approve the Matters to Be Voted on at the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 1 (election of directors): Each nominee for election as a director must receive more For votes than Against votes in order to be elected as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions and broker non-votes will not have any effect on the result of the vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 2 (the say-on-pay vote): This proposal requires for approval the affirmative vote of a majority of the shares present in person or represented by proxy and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions will have the same effect as a vote Against.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker non-votes will not have any effect on the result of the vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 3 (the advisory vote to approve the frequency of the advisory vote to approve executive compensation): The determination as to whether the say-on-pay vote shall occur every one, two or three years will be decided by a plurality of the votes cast among the three alternatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This means that the alternative receiving the most votes will be considered to be the expressed preference of the stockholders, even if those votes do not constitute a majority of the shares of stock entitled to vote on the matter present in person or by proxy at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions and broker non-votes will have no effect on the outcome of this vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 4 (ratification of the appointment of Ernst & Young LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for 2017): This proposal requires for approval the affirmative vote of a majority of the shares present in person or represented by proxy and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions will have the same effect as a vote Against.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Brokers will have discretionary authority to vote on Item 4, and therefore, there will not be any broker non-votes on this matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Can I Change My Vote After I Have Voted?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a stockholder of record, you may change your vote by voting again over the Internet or by telephone (before those voting facilities are closed at 11:59 p.m. Eastern Daylight Time on May 23, 2017) or by returning a new, properly completed proxy card bearing a later date than the date of your original proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, you may revoke your proxy by attending the Annual Meeting in person and requesting to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attendance at the meeting in person will not, by itself, revoke your proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may also revoke your proxy any time before the final vote at the Annual Meeting by filing a signed notice of revocation with the Secretary of the Company at 28161 North Keith Drive, Lake Forest, Illinois 60045.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a beneficial owner of shares held in street name, you may revoke your proxy by following the instructions provided by your broker.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The preliminary voting results will be announced at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The final voting results will be tallied by the inspector of elections and reported in a current report on Form 8-K which we will file with the SEC within four business days following the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will bear the cost of this proxy solicitation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some of our officers and employees may solicit proxies by personal conversations, telephone, regular mail or email, but they will not receive any additional compensation for doing so.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will reimburse brokers and others for their reasonable charges and expenses in forwarding our proxy materials to stockholders who are beneficial owners of shares of our common stock.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why Did We Receive Only One Mailing?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are sending only one envelope with multiple Notices to you if you share a single address with another stockholder, unless we have received instructions to the contrary from you.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This practice, known as householding, is designed to eliminate duplicate mailings, conserve natural resources and reduce our printing and mailing costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will promptly deliver a separate Notice to you upon written or verbal request.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you wish to receive duplicate mailings in the future, you may contact Investor Relations, Stericycle, Inc., 28161 North Keith Drive, Lake Forest, Illinois 60045.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you currently receive multiple Notices, you can request householding by contacting our Investor Relations as described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you own your shares through a broker, you can request householding by contacting the holder of record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you plan to attend the meeting in person, please complete and return the Admission Request Form on the back cover of this proxy statement and an admissions card will be mailed to you.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are the beneficial owner of shares held in street name, you must also provide confirmation of your stock ownership with your Admission Request Form (for example, by providing a copy of a brokerage firm statement).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Admission Request Forms must be received by May 17, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An admissions card is not transferable and will admit only the stockholder or stockholders to whom it was issued.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you need directions to the meeting, please call Investor Relations at (800) 643-0240 ext. 2012.

sentences.text: ITEM 1 Election of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board is currently composed of 12 directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With the exception of Mark C. Miller, our Chairman of the Board, and Charles A. Alutto, our President and Chief Executive Officer, all of our directors are outside directors (i.e., directors who are neither officers nor employees of ours).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Miller transitioned from the role of Executive Chairman of the Board to Chairman of the Board immediately following our 2016 Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although Mr. Miller is no longer an officer of the Company, he continues to be an employee of the Company and therefore is not an outside director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that all of our outside directors are independent under the applicable listing standards of the NASDAQ Global Select Market (NASDAQ).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director elected at the Annual Meeting will hold office until our 2018 Annual Meeting of Stockholders or until his or her successor is elected and qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting in Uncontested Director Elections
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our bylaws, a nominee for election as a director must receive a majority of the votes cast in order to be elected as a director in an uncontested election (an election in which the number of nominees for election is the same as the number of directors to be elected).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In other words, the nominee must receive more for votes than against votes, with abstentions and broker non-votes not having any effect on the voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a nominee for election as a director is an incumbent director and the nominee is not re-elected, Delaware law provides that the director continues to serve as a holdover director until his successor is elected and qualified or until he resigns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our bylaws, an incumbent director who is not re-elected is required to tender his resignation as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Nominating and Governance Committee will review the circumstances and recommend to the Board whether to accept or reject the directors resignation or take any other action.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is required to act on this recommendation and publicly disclose its decision and the rationale behind its decision within 90 days from the date that the election results are certified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Changes to Our Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Messrs. Dammeyer and Hall will not be standing for re-election at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company thanks Messrs. Dammeyer and Hall for their many years of distinguished service to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As previously disclosed Messrs. Anderson and Murley joined our Board in January 2017 and will be standing for election at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Messrs. Anderson and Murley were first identified as candidates for directors by certain members of our outside directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Should all director nominees be elected to the Board at the Annual Meeting, the number of directors constituting the Board will be decreased from 12 to 10 directors.

sentences.text: Director Since May 1992 Age 61
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mark C. Miller has served as our Chairman since May 2016 and prior to that he was our Executive Chairman since January 2013.

sentences.text: Mr. Miller has been a director since May 1992.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He became our Chief Executive Officer in May 1992 and Chairman of the Board of Directors in August 2008, and served in each of those roles until January 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From May 1989 until joining us, Mr. Miller served as vice president for the Pacific, Asia and Africa in the international division of Abbott Laboratories, a diversified health care company, which he joined in 1976 and where he held a number of management and marketing positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Miller serves as a director of Accelerate Diagnostics, Inc., a developer of automated diagnostics systems, and formerly served as a director of Ventana Medical Systems, Inc., a developer and supplier of automated diagnostic systems.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He received a B.S. degree in computer science from Purdue University, where he graduated Phi Beta Kappa.

sentences.text: Mr. Zafirovski is the founder and president of The Zaf Group LLC, a management consulting and investment firm established in November 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Zafirovski has also served as an executive advisor to The Blackstone Group, a private investment banking company, since October 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From November 2005 to August 2009, Mr. Zafirovski served as the president and chief executive officer and a director of Nortel Networks Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to that, he was the president and chief operating officer and a director of Motorola, Inc. from July 2002 to January 2005, and remained a consultant to and a director of Motorola until May 2005.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He served as executive vice president and president of the personal communications sector of Motorola from June 2000 to July 2002.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining Motorola, Mr. Zafirovski spent nearly 25 years with General Electric Company, where he served in management positions, including 13 years as president and chief executive officer of five businesses in the consumer, industrial and financial services areas, his most recent being president and chief executive officer of GE Lighting from July 1999 to May 2000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Zafirovski also serves as a director of The Boeing Company and two private companies (Apria Healthcare Group Inc. and non-executive chairman of the board for DJO Global, Inc.).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He received a B.A. degree in mathematics from Edinboro University in Pennsylvania.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Qualifications
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our 10 director nominees possess the experience, qualifications and skills that warrant their election as directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our directors have in common, among other qualities, a breadth of business experience, seasoned judgment and an insistence on looking beyond the next quarter or the next year in directing and supporting our management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From their service on the boards of other public and private companies, our directors also bring to us the insights that they gain from the operating policies, governance structures and growth dynamics of these other companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our directors individually bring to the Board a wide range of experience, backgrounds and knowledge.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among other things that each of our directors brings: Mr. Miller brings a wealth of knowledge of our industry; Mr. Schuler brings experience managing the operations of a multinational healthcare company and knowledge of the dynamics of the healthcare industry; Mr. Alutto brings experience in sales and marketing, operations, and general management of our industry; Mr. Anderson brings financial experience from both healthcare and business products; Ms. Bleil brings significant expertise in the healthcare industry; Mr. Brown brings experience managing the operations of a multinational diagnostics business; Mr. Chen brings experience in managing and expanding the operations of a multinational nutrition business in Asia and emerging markets; Mr. Murley brings experience from the investment securities industry; Mr. Patience brings experience with public and private healthcare companies; and Mr. Zafirovski brings experience managing the operations of multinational communications and technology companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When the Board elected Mr. Zafirovski as a director in November 2012, it was aware that Nortel Networks Corporation had filed for bankruptcy protection in January 2009 while Mr. Zafirovski was serving as its president and chief executive officer and a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board concluded that this event did not impair Mr. Zafirovskis ability to serve as one of the Companys directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committees of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has three standing committees: Compensation, Audit, and Nominating and Governance Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the members of each committee are outside directors who are independent under the applicable NASDAQ listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee makes recommendations to the Board of Directors concerning the base salaries and cash bonuses of our executive officers and reviews our employee compensation policies generally.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee also administers our stock option plans as they apply to our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the committee periodically reviews our compensation practices to evaluate whether they pose enterprise or other risks to us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee assists the Board of Directors in fulfilling its oversight responsibilities relating to the integrity of our financial statements, the qualifications and experience of our independent accountants, the performance of our internal audit function and our independent accountants, and our compliance with legal and regulatory requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee reviews our risk management policies and practices and reports any significant issues to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Matters of risk management are brought to the committees attention by our Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, our Executive Vice President and General Counsel or by our principal internal auditor who focuses on potential weaknesses that could result in a failure of an internal control process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our management reviews and reports on potential areas of risk at the committees request or at the request of other members of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominating and Governance Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee identifies and evaluates possible nominees for election to the Board of Directors and recommends to the Board a slate of nominees for election at the annual meeting of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee also recommends to the Board director assignments to the Boards committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the committee develops, recommends to the Board and oversees the implementation of our corporate governance policies and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee considers a variety of factors in evaluating a candidate for selection as a nominee for election as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These factors include the candidates personal qualities, with a particular emphasis on probity, independence of judgment and analytical skills, and the candidates professional experience, educational background, knowledge of our business and healthcare services generally and experience serving on the boards of other public companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In evaluating a
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: candidates qualification for election to the Board, the committee also considers whether and how the candidate would contribute to the Boards diversity, which we define broadly to include gender and ethnicity as well as background, experience and other individual qualities and attributes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee has not established any minimum qualifications that a candidate must possess.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining whether to recommend an ncumbent director for re-election, the committee also considers the directors preparation for and participation in meetings of the Board of Directors and the committee or committees of the Board on which the director serves.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In identifying potential candidates for selection in the future as nominees for election as directors, the Nominating and Governance Committee relies on suggestions and recommendations from the other directors, management, stockholders and others and, when appropriate, may retain a search firm for assistance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee will consider candidates proposed by stockholders and will evaluate any candidate proposed by a stockholder on the same basis that it evaluates any other candidate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any stockholder who wants to propose a candidate should submit a written recommendation to the committee indicating the candidates qualifications and other relevant biographical information and providing preliminary confirmation that the candidate would be willing to serve as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any such recommendation should be addressed to the Board of Directors, Stericycle, Inc., 28161 North Keith Drive, Lake Forest, Illinois 60045.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to recommending director candidates to the Nominating and Governance Committee, stockholders may also, pursuant to procedures established in our bylaws, directly nominate one or more director candidates to stand for election at an annual meeting of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A stockholder wishing to make such a nomination must deliver written notice of the nomination to the secretary of the Company not less than 90 days nor more than 120 days prior to the first anniversary of the preceding years annual meeting of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If, however, the date of the annual meeting is more than 30 days before or after the first anniversary, the stockholders notice must be received no more than 120 days prior to such annual meeting nor less than the later of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (x) 90 days prior to such annual meeting and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (y) the close of business on the 10th day following the date on which notice or public disclosure of the date of the meeting was first given or made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders may also submit director nominees to the Board to be included in our annual proxy statement, known as proxy access.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders who intend to submit director nominees for inclusion in our proxy materials for the 2018 Annual Meeting of Stockholders must comply with the requirements of proxy access as set forth in our bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The stockholder or group of stockholders who wish to submit director nominees pursuant to proxy access must deliver the required materials to the Company not less than 120 days nor more than 150 days prior to the anniversary of the date that the Company first mailed its proxy materials for the annual meeting of the previous year.

sentences.text: Lead Director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our bylaws require the Board of Directors to appoint one of our outside directors as the Lead Director if and when our president and chief executive, or any other officer or employee, is serving as the Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Lead Director is required to be independent under the NASDAQ listing standards, and serves at the Boards pleasure until the next election of directors by the stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although Mr. Miller is no longer an officer of the Company, he is not independent under the applicable NASDAQ listing standards and therefore Mr. Schuler has continued as our Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Working with the Chairman of the Board, the Lead Director is responsible for coordinating the scheduling and agenda of Board meetings and the preparation and distribution of agenda materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Lead Director presides when the Board meets in executive session or in the absence of the Chairman of the Board and may call special meetings of the Board when he considers appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, the Lead Director oversees the scope, quality and timeliness of the flow of information from our management to the Board and serves as an independent point of contact for stockholders wishing to communicate with the Board other than through the Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In August 2008, our Chairman of the Board, Jack W. Schuler, resigned as Chairman after serving for more than 18 years, and our Board appointed Mr. Schuler as our Lead Director, and he still serves in this position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also in August 2008, the Board appointed our then President and Chief Executive Officer, Mark C. Miller, who had served in these positions for more than 16 years, to the additional position of Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective January 2013, Charles A. Alutto became our President and Chief Executive Officer and Mr. Miller assumed the position of Executive Chairman of the Board, which he held until May 2016 when he transitioned in to the role of Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At this time, the Board believes that the Chairman, together with the Lead Director, serve the Company well.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The combined experience and knowledge of Messrs. Alutto, Miller and Schuler in their respective roles of Chief Executive Officer, Chairman and Lead Director provide the Board and the Company with continuity of leadership that has enabled the Companys success with sufficient independent oversight of the Board through our Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Sessions of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors excuses Mr. Alutto, our President and Chief Executive Officer, as well as any of our other executive officers who may be present by invitation, from a portion of each meeting of the Board in order to allow the Board, with our Lead Director presiding, to review Mr. Aluttos performance as President and Chief Executive Officer and to enable each director to raise any matter of interest or concern without the presence of management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Evaluation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our directors annually review the performance of the Board of Directors and its committees and the performance of their fellow directors by completing confidential evaluation forms that are returned to Mr. Schuler as the Chairman of the Nominating and Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At a subsequent meeting of the Board, Mr. Schuler leads a discussion with the full Board of any issues and suggestions for improvement identified in his review of these evaluation forms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of this policy, a related party includes any director or executive officer or an immediate family member of any director or executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Succession Planning
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors annually reviews and approves our succession planning for our Chief Executive Officer, our other executive officers and a number of other officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board regularly devotes time during its meetings to review and discuss the most significant risks facing the Company, and managements responses to those risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During these discussions, the Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer, General Counsel and other members of senior management present managements assessment of risks, a description of the most significant risks facing the Company and any mitigating factors and plans or practices in place to address and monitor those risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board conducts an annual, in-depth review of the Companys business, which includes detailed analysis and consideration of strategic, operational, financial, competitive, compliance and compensation risk areas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Board committee addresses relevant risk topics as part of its committee responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committees oversee the Companys risk profile and exposures relating to matters within the scope of their authority and provide periodic reports to the full Board about their deliberations and recommendations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is responsible for overseeing the management of risks relating to the Companys executive compensation plans and its overall compensation philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Responsibility for risk management flows to individuals and entities throughout our Company as described above, including our Board, Board committees and senior management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our culture has facilitated, and will continue to facilitate, effective risk management across the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Required Resignation on Change in Job Responsibilities
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has adopted a policy that a director must tender his resignation if the directors principal occupation or business association changes substantially from the position that he held when originally elected to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee will then review the circumstances of the directors new position or retirement and recommend to the full Board whether to accept or reject the directors resignation in light of the contribution that he can be expected to continue to make to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Anti-Hedging and Anti-Pledging Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our directors, executive officers and other designated employees are prohibited from engaging in certain transactions in respect of our common stock including hedging transactions, derivative transactions and short sales.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, these persons are prohibited from holding our common stock in a margin account or otherwise pledging our common stock as collateral for a loan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to encourage sound financial reporting and enhance individual accountability, we have adopted a clawback policy that allows us to recover from our executive officers certain performance-based compensation in the event of certain accounting restatements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we are required to prepare a restatement of our financial statements due to material noncompliance with any financial reporting requirement under the securities laws, the Compensation Committee will seek to recover from a covered officer certain performance-based compensation if the covered officer is determined to have engaged in fraud or intentional misconduct that materially contributed to the need for the restatement or if otherwise required by applicable SEC or NASDAQ rules.

sentences.text: Director Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation in 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2016, the Board modified our Outside Directors Compensation Plan to align the compensation of our outside directors with the changes made to the compensation of our executive officers and with the market generally.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our goal in making such changes was to provide compensation that aligned with the median compensation awarded by our peers to ensure we can continue to attract and retain a high caliber board of outside directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These changes became effective in 2017 and are described below under Compensation Plan for 2017 and 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each directors compensation for 2016 was $125,000 (the annual retainer) which was paid primarily in stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors who had already satisfied our stock ownership guidelines could elect to receive full or partial payment of the annual retainer in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One director chose to receive he retainer in cash which was paid in twelve equal monthly installments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All other directors received their annual retainer in two pieces:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) a stock option reflecting the conversion of 75%, or $93,750, of the annual retainer, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) a time-based RSU award reflecting the conversion of the emaining 25%, or $31,250.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors have received new option and RSU awards each year when elected, or reelected, at the annual meeting of stockholders, including the annual meeting held in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 awards vest on May 25, 2017, the first anniversary of the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Hall elected to receive his 2016 annual retainer in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This included an additional $5,000 awarded for his service as Chairman of the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Dammeyer received an additional $10,000, delivered in the form of 297 options and 40 RSUs, for his service as Chairman of the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We did not pay any other fees or other cash compensation to our directors who served during 2016 or provide them with any perquisites or other personal benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are not paid separate fees for attending meetings of the Board of Directors or its committees, and no fees were paid to the Chairman of the Board for his service as chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Plan for 2017 and 2018
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the request of the Nominating and Governance Committee, the Compensation Committee engaged Deloitte Consulting LLP as an independent compensation consultant during 2016 to benchmark Stericycles compensation plan for its Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on peer benchmarking data provided by the compensation consultant, the Compensation Committee determined that Stericycles outside directors were not compensated on par with their counterparts at other companies in our peer group or in the market generally.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stericycles outside director total compensation in 2016 was 37% below the peer group median, and Stericycle was one of only three companies in our peer group to award options as the predominant form of director compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to remedy that disparity so Stericycle can continue to attract a diverse group of experienced professionals to serve on the Board, the Compensation Committee recommended adding a cash component to the Outside Directors Compensation Plan in 2017 that would bring the compensation program in alignment with the median of our peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board opted to adjust director compensation in two stages over 2017 and 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning in 2017, directors will receive a cash retainer of $40,000 and an annual equity award of $125,000 in the form of time-based RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will continue to pay an additional $10,000 to the Chairman of the Audit Committee, and $5,000 to the Chairman of the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Should a director join the Board mid-year, that individual will receive compensation that is pro-rated for the portion of the year he or she will be in active service to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning in 2018, the directors annual cash retainer will increase to $80,000 and the annual equity award will remain at $125,000 delivered entirely in time-based RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we will pay the following additional retainers beginning in 2018 to be more in line with our peer group:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chairman of the Audit Committee$20,000
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chairman of the Compensation Committee$15,000
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chairman of the Nominating and Governance Committee$12,500
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lead Director$25,000
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our Outside Directors Compensation Plan, all directors are expected to hold a minimum position in our stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stericycle established this program to help align the long-term interests of directors with the interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each non-employee director is expected to hold four times the annual cash retainer in Stericycle, Inc. common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although there is no specific period of time in which directors are required to achieve the applicable ownership threshold, they are expected to make continuous progress toward that goal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To that end, each non-employee director must retain 75% of his or her stock or option awards until the minimum position requirement has been achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compliance with these ownership guidelines is measured following the same process as used for confirming stock ownership by executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Stock Ownership Guidelines under the Other Compensation Matters section.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ITEM 2 Advisory Vote to Approve Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to Section 14A of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (the Exchange Act), we are asking our stockholders to approve, by means of a non-binding advisory vote, the compensation of our named executive officers as disclosed in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proposal, popularly known as say-on-pay, enables stockholders to express or withhold their approval of our executive compensation program in general.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The vote is intended to provide an assessment by our stockholders of our overall executive compensation program and not of any one or more particular elements of that program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee and the full Board intend to consider and take into account the outcome of this non-binding advisory vote in making future executive compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because this vote is advisory and non-binding, it will not necessarily affect or otherwise limit any future compensation of any of our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This advisory vote to approve executive compensation will be held on an annual basis at least until the next advisory vote to determine the frequency of such vote which will occur at the Annual Meeting (see Item 3).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program is described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section of this proxy statement and the related tables and narrative discussion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders are strongly urged to read this material in its entirety, and in particular to read the Executive Summary on pages 2225, to obtain an informed understanding of our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our executive compensation program is firmly aligned with the long-term interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program has as its objectives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) attracting, motivating and retaining highly qualified executive officers and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) structuring most of their compensation, aside from their base salaries, to be dependent on the Companys attainment of measurable Company-wide performance targets and the sustained growth in our stock price, so that they benefit only if our stockholders benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our executive compensation program satisfies these objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program consists of cash compensation and long-term incentive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, cash compensation was paid in the form of a base salary and an annual cash performance bonus based on 75% Adjusted EBITDA (earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization) and 25% Adjusted ROIC return on invested capital), and long-term incentive compensation was paid in the form of stock options and RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual cash performance bonuses are dependent on Company-wide performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options and RSUs are only granted at the closing market price on the date of grant and are dependent for their value on the subsequent growth in value of our stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, base salary represented 22%, annual performance bonuses 3%, and equity compensation 75% of our NEOs total direct compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual performance bonuses were only 3% because we underperformed against our performance objectives and the bonus was paid at 13% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For these reasons and the reasons elaborated more fully in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section and the related tables and narrative discussion, the Board of Directors requests stockholders to approve the following resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Resolved, that the stockholders approve the compensation paid to the Companys named executive officers, as disclosed in this proxy statement, including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section and the related compensation tables and narrative discussion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends a vote FOR this advisory vote to approve executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our 2016 Named Executive Officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Compensation Discussion and Analysis explains our executive compensation program generally, and the compensation awarded to our CEO, CFO, and three other most highly compensated executives specifically.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These executives, referred to as our Named Executive Officers or NEOs, were:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Name Title Charles A. Alutto President and Chief Executive Officer Joseph B. Arnold Chief Operating Officer Daniel V. Ginnetti Chief Financial Officer Michael Collins Executive Vice President Brenda R. Frank Chief People Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stericycles Executive Compensation Philosophy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executive compensation program at Stericycle is developed by the Compensation Committee and approved annually by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation program for executive officers has two objectives:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. To attract, motivate and retain highly qualified executive officers; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. To structure the bulk of executive compensation to be dependent on Stericycles attainment of measurable company-wide performance targets and sustained growth in our stock price so that executives benefit only if our stockholders benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program has three components: base salary, short-term incentive awards, and long-term incentive awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salary and annual performance bonuses are paid in cash, and long-term incentive compensation is paid in the form of stock options and RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We generally target our executive officers total direct compensation to be aligned with the median of our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To ensure appropriate pay- or performance alignment, the Compensation Committee may approve compensation levels for individual executive officers above and below arget pay positions, based on experience, individual contribution, and the Companys performance relative to its peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee and the Board work to ensure that our executive compensation program is both market-competitive and performance-oriented.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive officers earn base salaries, but the majority of their compensation comes in annual cash performance bonuses, stock options and RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, a substantial portion of our executive officers compensation is influenced, either positively or negatively, by Stericycles performance and by stockholder return.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Executive Compensation Best Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee regularly reviews the executive compensation program to ensure that it is aligned with our compensation philosophy, our Company objectives, and stockholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Highlights of key elements of and exclusions from our program are noted below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Do:   What We Dont Do: Deliver significant percentage of target annual compensation as variable compensation tied to performance   No re-pricing of underwater stock options Align executives interests with stockholders interests through long-term incentive compensation paid in equity and with stock ownership guidelines     No perquisites or personal benefits Maintain an executive compensation claw back policy   No tax gross-ups Cap annual and long-term incentive awards       Retain an independent compensation consultant to advise the Compensation Committee       Prohibit officers and directors from engaging in hedge, pledge or short sale transactions involving our securities
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stericycle, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: - 2017 Proxy Statement    22

sentences.text: Our Executive Compensation Program for 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Historically, our named executive officers received salaries significantly below those of comparable executives in our peer group of companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning in 2015, the Compensation Committee embarked on a four-year plan to move salaries of our executive officers toward the median of our peer group of companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subsequent to our acquisition of Shred-it in 2015, the Compensation Committee determined that this four year time table needed to be accelerated to reflect the increased responsibilities of the executives, to preserve internal equity, and to support retention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to 2016, our executive officers have earned annual cash performance bonuses based upon the achievement of Adjusted EBITDA targets developed from our annual operating plan and budget.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted EBITDA is defined as earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization excluding acquisition-related expenses and other various expenses that do not reflect the ongoing performance of the business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016 Adjusted EBITDA was adjusted to exclude the impact of acquisition expenses, integration expenses, restructuring and plant conversion expenses, amortization expense, the change in fair value of contingent considerations, contract exit costs, asset impairment charges, litigation expenses, and insurance proceeds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The approach used for Adjusted EBITDA for executive compensation is consistent with that used for communicating the financial performance of the company and is reviewed quarterly by both the Audit Committee and Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning in 2016, we added adjusted return on invested capital (Adjusted ROIC) as a second performance metric to our annual bonus program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted ROIC excludes the impact of acquisitions within the current year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The calculation for Adjusted ROIC is net operating profit after taxes and amortization (NOPATA) excluding acquisition-related expenses and other various expenses that do not reflect the ongoing performance of the business divided by invested capital.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016 ROIC excluded the impact of acquisition expenses, integration expenses, restructuring and plant conversion expenses, the change in fair value of contingent considerations, contract exit costs, asset impairment charges, litigation expenses, and insurance proceeds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes these two metrics for the cash performance bonus provide strong incentives to our executive officers to improve our operating performance and the return on our capital employed, thereby creating value for our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executives are also compensated with a long-term incentive program in the form of equity grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to 2016, the equity grants were in the form of stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the award structure of the long-term incentive plan was modified to include 75% of awards granted as stock options and 25% of awards granted as RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These grants of stock options and RSUs were designed to incentivize our named executive officers to focus on long-term value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The principal elements of Stericycles executive compensation program for 2016 are summarized below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These elements are discussed in more detail under 2016 Compensation Program Highlights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Element Form of Compensation Performance and Vesting Criteria Purpose Base Salary Cash N/A Provide fixed compensation to attract and retain key executives and to offset external factors that may impact incentive pay Annual Cash Bonus Cash Annual Adjusted EBITDA and Adjusted ROIC objectives Incentivize executives to achieve annual performance goals and be rewarded commensurately Long-term Incentives Stock Options (75%) RSUs (25%) Five year ratable vesting  based on continuous service Incentivize long-term value creation and align managements interests with those of our shareholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Decision-Making Processes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee takes into account a number of factors in setting compensation and incentive award opportunities for our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These decisions are made with a view to reaching an overall result that the Committee believes is appropriate and fair to each NEOboth in absolute terms and relative to the compensation of the other executive officersand fair as well to Stericycle and to our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also considers each executive officers role, contribution to our performance, and the officers compensation history n making compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation decisions are made at the regular meeting of the Compensation Committee during the first quarter of the yeartypically in February, when the results of our prior years performance are available.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considers these results in determining the executive officers annual cash performance bonuses for the prior year and their base salaries and annual cash performance bonus targets for the current year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Chief Executive Officer makes recommendations to the Compensation Committee regarding the compensation of our other NEOs, but management does not otherwise participate in the Committees decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee provides a recommendation for the salary of our Chief Executive Officer, but the Board must provide final approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Decisions regarding the annual stock option and RSU grants to our executive officers and to our employees generally are also made during the first Compensation Committee meeting of the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the grant date for options or RSUs is set more than a year in advance of this meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee determines the annual stock option and RSU grants to our executive officers taking into account
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) Stericycles overall operating performance,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) each executive officers individual responsibilities and performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) competitive market data,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) prior stock option grants,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) the goal of limiting stock option and RSU grants to no more than 10% of our fully-diluted shares over a trailing five-year period, thus averaging dilution of no more than 2% a year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Consultant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning in 2014, the Compensation Committee engaged Deloitte Consulting LLP, as its independent compensation consultant, to review our executive compensation philosophy and practices and the composition of our peer group of companies over the past several years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Taking the results of the consultants review over the past three years into consideration, the Compensation Committee has been executing plans to adjust our executive compensation program to be in alignment with peers, as described below under Key Changes to the Compensation Program for 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Compensation Program Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salaries
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Data provided by the compensation consultant showed that base salaries for our NEOs were substantially below the median of our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2015, the Compensation Committee determined that Stericycle needed to increase base salaries to make our compensation packages more competitive in the market for executive talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rather than make all pay adjustments in a single year, the Committee originally opted to increase base salaries over four years beginning in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the NEOs base salaries were increased for 2016 as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * Mr. Arnold was not an NEO in 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ** Ms. Frank was not an NEO in 2014 or 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With these increases, base salaries for our NEOs were still substantially below the median for our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed below under Key Changes to the Compensation Program for 2017, the Compensation Committee opted to accelerate the final phase of the four-year plan for base salary increases in 2017 to align our NEOs total direct compensation more closely with compensation awarded by our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Cash Performance Bonuses
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our annual cash performance bonus program is intended to reward our executive officers for achieving our annual operating plans and budgets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each executive officer is eligible for an annual cash performance bonus equal to a specified percentage of base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Historically, our executive officers earned annual cash performance bonuses based solely upon the achievement of Adjusted EBITDA targets developed from our annual operating plan and budget.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning in 2016, we added a second performance metricadjusted return on invested capital (Adjusted ROIC)to our annual bonus program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes the Adjusted ROIC metric is an appropriate addition for determining a short-term incentive to reflect the value of investment decisions, especially acquisition investments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, 75% of each NEOs 2016 annual cash performance bonus was tied to achievement of our Adjusted EBITDA goal and 25% was tied to achievement of our Adjusted ROIC goal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed below under 2017 Compensation Decisions, the Compensation Committee revised the annual cash performance bonus program for 2017 to give more weight to the Adjusted ROIC metric.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Goals for 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based upon our annual business plans, the Compensation Committee established minimum, target, and maximum achievement levels for the Adjusted EBITDA portion of the annual cash performance bonus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the Adjusted EBITDA target was $981.9 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There was no payout if we failed to attain Adjusted EBITDA of $932.9 million, and the payout for performance at or above the maximum goal of $1,031.1 million was capped at 200%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As with the Adjusted EBITDA portion of the bonus, the Compensation Committee fixes minimum, target, and maximum Adjusted ROIC performance goals and related payout percentages.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the Adjusted ROIC target was 8.64%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There was no payout if we failed to attain the minimum Adjusted ROIC of 7.61%, and the payout for performance at or above the maximum goal of 9.57% was capped at 200%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table shows how different levels of actual Adjusted EBITDA and Adjusted ROIC were designed to affect the payout.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted EBITDA  Cash Bonus Program for 2016  75% Total Cash Bonus   Adjusted ROIC  Cash Bonus Program for 2016  25% Total Cash Bonus     Percentage of Award Payout   Percent Adjusted EBITDA Attainment   Adjusted EBITDA Target (in $ millions)   Percentage of Award Payout   Adjusted ROIC Target Minimum   50%  95%  $ 932.8  50%  7.61% Target   100%  100%  981.9  100%  8.64% Maximum   200%  105% or more  1,031.1 or more  200%  9.57% or more
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both sets of performance targets allow for payout of the annual cash performance bonuses at levels that increase proportionally from the minimum tier (an annual cash performance bonus equal to the specified percentage of the executive officers base salary) to the maximum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Equity Incentive Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committees first step when making long-term equity incentive awards is to determine the desired total grant date fair value of each NEOs award in the manner described above under Our Compensation-Setting Process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, 75% of that total amount was awarded in the form of stock options, and the remaining 25% was awarded in the form of time-based RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Option Grants for 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Until 2016, executive officers long-term incentive awards were entirely in the form of stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With the addition of RSUs to the long-term incentive program, stock options constituted 75% of our NEOs long-term compensation in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes stock options provide strong performance incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our stock options are always granted at the closing price of our stock on the date of the grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Options vest over a period of five years and must be exercised within eight years, so their value to our executive officers depends entirely on the growth in the value of our stock in the years after the options are issued.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the executive officers stock options provide an incentive for sustained levels of superior performance that contribute to our overall success as reflected in the market price of our stock, which benefits all of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
